verses.original: ओ-न्नमो भगवते॑ रुद्रा॒य ॥
verses.transliteration: ō-nnamō bhagavatē̍ rudrā̠ya ॥
verses.translation: Om. Salutations to the venerable Rudra.

verses.original:
नम॑स्ते रुद्र म॒न्यव॑ उ॒तोत॒ इष॑वे॒ नमः॑ ।
नम॑स्ते अस्तु॒ धन्व॑ने बा॒हुभ्या॑मु॒त ते॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration:
nama̍stē rudra ma̠nyava̍ u̠tōta̠ iṣa̍vē̠ nama̍ḥ ।
nama̍stē astu̠ dhanva̍nē bā̠hubhyā̍mu̠ta tē̠ nama̍ḥ ॥
verses.translation: Salutations to your **anger**, O Rudra, and also to your **arrow**. Salutations to your **bow**, and to your two **arms**.

verses.original:
या त॒ इषुः॑ शि॒वत॑मा शि॒व-म्ब॒भूव॑ ते॒ धनुः॑ ।
शि॒वा श॑र॒व्या॑ या तव॒ तया॑ नो रुद्र मृडय ।
verses.transliteration:
yā ta̠ iṣu̍-śśi̠vata̍mā śi̠va-mba̠bhūva̍ tē̠ dhanu̍ḥ ।
śi̠vā śa̍ra̠vyā̍ yā tava̠ tayā̍ nō rudra mṛḍaya ।
verses.translation: May your most benevolent arrow and your most auspicious bow, and the benevolent quiver you bear, please **show mercy to us**, O Rudra.

verses.original:
या ते॑ रुद्र शि॒वा त॒नूरघो॒रा-ऽपा॑पकाशिनी ।
तया॑ नस्त॒नुवा॒ शन्त॑मया॒ गिरि॑शन्ता॒भिचा॑कशीहि ॥
verses.transliteration:
yā tē̍ rudra śi̠vā ta̠nūraghō̠rā-‘pā̍pakāśinī ।
tayā̍ nasta̠nuvā̠ śanta̍mayā̠ giri̍śantā̠bhichā̍kaśīhi ॥
verses.translation: O Rudra, your form which is **auspicious**, not dreadful, and free from sin—with that most peaceful form, O mountain-dweller (**Giriśanta**), **look upon us**.

verses.original:
यामिषु॑-ङ्गिरिशन्त॒ हस्ते॒ बिभ॒र्​ष्यस्त॑वे ।
शि॒वा-ङ्गि॑रित्र॒ ता-ङ्कु॑रु॒ मा हिग्ं॑सीः॒ पुरु॑ष॒-ञ्जग॑त्॥
verses.transliteration:
yāmiṣu̍-ṅgiriśanta̠ hastē̠ bibha̠r​ṣyasta̍vē ।
śi̠vā-ṅgi̍ritra̠ tā-ṅku̍ru̠ mā hig̍ṃsī̠ḥ puru̍ṣa̠-ñjaga̍t॥
verses.translation: O dweller of the mountain (**Giritra**), make auspicious the arrow you hold in your hand for shooting; **do not injure** our people or the world.

verses.original:
शि॒वेन॒ वच॑सा त्वा॒ गिरि॒शाच्छा॑ वदामसि ।
यथा॑ न॒-स्सर्व॒मिज्जग॑दय॒क्ष्मग्ं सु॒मना॒ अस॑त् ॥
verses.transliteration:
śi̠vēna̠ vacha̍sā tvā̠ giri̠śāchChā̍ vadāmasi ।
yathā̍ na̠-ssarva̠mijjaga̍daya̠kṣmagṃ su̠manā̠ asa̍t ॥
verses.translation: We invoke you, O mountain-dweller (**Giriśa**), with auspicious words, so that all this world may be **free of sickness and happy** for us.

verses.original:
अध्य॑वोचदधिव॒क्ता प्र॑थ॒मो दैव्यो॑ भि॒षक् ।
अहीग्॑श्च॒ सर्वा᳚ञ्ज॒म्भय॒न्-थ्सर्वा᳚श्च यातुधा॒न्यः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration:
adhya̍vocadadhiva̱ktā pra̍tha̱mo daivyo̍ bhi̱ṣak . 
ahīg̍śca̱ sarvā̎ñja̠mbhaya̠n-thsarvā̎ścha yātudhā̠nya̍ḥ ..
verses.translation: The divine physician, the foremost advocate, has spoken in our favor, **destroying all serpents** and all demons (**Yātudhānas**).

verses.original:
अ॒सौ यस्ता॒म्रो अ॑रु॒ण उ॒त ब॒भ्रुस्सु॑म॒ङ्गलः॑ ।
ये चे॒माग्ं रु॒द्रा अ॒भितो॑ दि॒क्षु श्रि॒ता-स्स॑हस्र॒शो-ऽवैषा॒ग्ं॒ हेड॑ ईमहे ॥
verses.transliteration:
a̠sau yastā̠mrō a̍ru̠ṇa u̠ta ba̠bhrussu̍ma̠ṅgala̍ḥ ।
yē chē̠māgṃ ru̠drā a̠bhitō̍ di̠kṣu śri̠tā-ssa̍hasra̠śō-‘vaiṣā̠gṃ̠ hēḍa̍ īmahē ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to the Rudra who is **copper-red** (**Tāmra**), reddish-brown (**Aruṇa**), and golden-brown (**Babhru**), and **auspicious** (**Sumaṅgala**).
We supplicate for the removal of the **harm (Hēḍa)** from those **thousands of Rudras** who are dwelling in all directions around us.

verses.original:
अ॒सौ यो॑-ऽव॒सर्प॑ति॒ नील॑ग्रीवो॒ विलो॑हितः ।
उ॒तैन॑-ङ्गो॒पा अ॑दृश॒न्नदृ॑शन्नुदहा॒र्यः॑ ।
उ॒तैनं॒-विँश्वा॑ भू॒तानि॒ स दृ॒ष्टो मृ॑डयाति नः ॥
verses.transliteration:
a̠sau yō̍-‘va̠sarpa̍ti̠ nīla̍grīvō̠ vilō̍hitaḥ ।
u̠taina̍-ṅgō̠pā a̍dṛśa̠nnadṛ̍śannudahā̠rya̍ḥ ।
u̠taina̠ṃ viśvā̍ bhū̠tāni̠ sa dṛ̠ṣṭō mṛ̍ḍayāti naḥ ॥
verses.translation: That one who moves about, **blue-necked** (**Nīlagrīva**) and **blood-red** (**Vilōhita**) – the cowherds have seen him, and the water-bearers have seen him. May he, being seen, **bring happiness to us**.

verses.original:
नम॑स्ते अस्तु॒ नील॑ग्रीवाय सहस्रा॒क्षाय॑ मी॒ढुषे᳚ ।
अथो॒ ये अ॒स्य॒ सत्वा॑नो॒-ऽह-न्तेभ्यो॑-ऽकर॒न्नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration:
namō̍ astu̠ nīla̍grīvāya sahasrā̠kṣāya̍ mī̠ḍhuṣē̎ ।
athō̠ yē a̍sya̠ satvā̍nō̠-‘ha-ntēbhyō̍-‘kara̠nnama̍ḥ ॥
verses.translation: Salutations to the **blue-necked one** (**Nīlagrīva**), the **thousand-eyed one** (**Sahasrākṣa**), the **bountiful one** (**Mīḍhuṣē**). And to those beings (**Satvānas**) of his—I offer my salutations.

verses.original:
प्रमु॑ञ्च॒ धन्व॑न॒स्त्वमु॒भयो॒रार्त्नि॑ यो॒र्ज्याम् ।
याश्च॑ ते॒ हस्त॒ इष॑वः॒ परा॒ ता भ॑गवो वप ॥
verses.transliteration:
pramu̍ñcha̠ dhanva̍na̠stvamu̠bhayō̠rārtni̍ yō̠rjyām ।
yāścha̍ tē̠ hasta̠ iṣa̍va̠ḥ parā̠ tā bha̍gavō vapa ॥
verses.translation: **Release the string** from both ends of your bow. O Bhagavan, **cast away the arrows** from your hand.

verses.original:
अ॒व॒तत्य॒ धनु॒स्त्वग्ं सह॑स्राक्ष॒ शते॑षुधे ।
नि॒शीर्य॑ श॒ल्याना॒-म्मुखा॑ शि॒वो नः॑ सु॒मना॑ भव ॥
verses.transliteration:
a̠va̠tatya̠ dhanu̠stvagṃ saha̍srākṣa̠ śatē̍ṣudhē ।
ni̠śīrya̍ śa̠lyānā̠-mmukhā̍ śi̠vō na̍-ssu̠manā̍ bhava ॥
verses.translation: Having **unstrung your bow**, O thousand-eyed one, O keeper of a hundred quivers, and having **shattered the points of the darts**, be auspicious and kind to us.

verses.original:
विज्य॒-न्धनुः॑ कप॒र्दिनो॒ विश॑ल्यो॒ बाण॑वाग्ं उ॒त ।
अने॑शन्न॒स्येष॑व आ॒भुर॑स्य निष॒ङ्गथिः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vijya̠-ndhanu̍ḥ kapa̠rdinō̠ viśa̍lyō̠ bāṇa̍vāgṃ u̠ta ।
anē̍śanna̠syēṣa̍va ā̠bhura̍sya niṣa̠ṅgathi̍ḥ ॥
verses.translation: May the bow of the **Kapardin** (Rudra with matted hair) be **unstrung**, and his quiver be **without darts**. May his arrows be **powerless** and his quiver be **without strength**.

verses.original:
या ते॑ हे॒तिर्मी॑डुष्टम॒ हस्ते॑ ब॒भूव॑ ते॒ धनुः॑ ।
तया॒-ऽस्मान्, वि॒श्वत॒स्त्वम॑य॒क्ष्मया॒ परि॑ब्भुज ॥
verses.transliteration:
yā tē̍ hē̠tirmī̍ḍuṣṭama̠ hastē̍ ba̠bhūva̍ tē̠ dhanu̍ḥ ।
tayā̠-‘smān, vi̠śvata̠stvama̍ya̠kṣmayā̠ pari̍bbhuja ॥
verses.translation: O most bounteous one, may the weapon that is in your hand, and the bow that is yours, **protect us from all sides** with its non-injurious form.

verses.original:
नम॑स्ते अ॒स्त्वायु॑धा॒याना॑तताय धृ॒ष्णवे᳚ ।
उ॒भाभ्या॑मु॒त ते॒ नमो॑ बा॒हुभ्या॒-न्तव॒ धन्व॑ने ॥
verses.transliteration:
nama̍stē a̠stvāyu̍dhā̠yānā̍tatāya dhṛ̠ṣṇavē̎ ।
u̠bhābhyā̍mu̠ta tē̠ namō̍ bā̠hubhyā̠-ntava̠ dhanva̍nē ॥
verses.translation: Salutations to your **weapon** which is **unstrung** and **fearsome**. Salutations to your two **arms** and to your **bow**.

verses.original:
परि॑ ते॒ धन्व॑नो हे॒तिर॒स्मान् वृ॑णक्तु वि॒श्वतः॑ ।
अथो॒ य इ॑षु॒धिस्तवा॒रē अ॒स्मन्निधे॑हि॒ तम् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration:
pari̍ tē̠ dhanva̍nō hē̠tira̠smān vṛ̍ṇaktu vi̠śvata̍ḥ ।
athō̠ ya i̍ṣu̠dhistavā̠rē a̠smannidhē̍hi̠ tam ॥ 1 ॥
verses.translation: May the **striking force (Hēti)** of your bow **avoid us from all sides**. And may you place your quiver far away from us.

verses.original:
श्री शम्भ॑वे॒ नमः॑ ॥
नम॑स्ते अस्तु भगवन्-विश्वेश्व॒राय॑ महादे॒वाय॑ त्र्यम्ब॒काय॑ त्रिपुरान्त॒काय॑
त्रिकाग्निका॒लाय॑ कालाग्निरु॒द्राय॑ नीलक॒ण्ठाय॑
मृत्युञ्ज॒याय॑ सर्वेश्व॒राय॑ सदाशि॒वाय॑ [शङ्क॒राय॑] श्रीम-न्महादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ।
verses.transliteration:
śrī śambha̍vē̠ nama̍ḥ ॥
nama̍stē astu bhagavan-viśvēśva̠rāya̍ mahādē̠vāya̍ tryamba̠kāya̍ tripurānta̠kāya̍ trikāgnikā̠lāya̍ kālāgniru̠drāya̍ nīlaka̠ṇṭhāya̍ mṛtyuñja̠yāya̍ sarvēśva̠rāya̍ sadāśi̠vāya̍ [śaṅka̠rāya̍] śrīma-nmahādē̠vāya̠ nama̍ḥ ।
verses.translation:
Salutations to **Śrī Śambhu**.
Salutations to the venerable Lord, the **Lord of the Universe** (**Viśvēśvarāya**), the **Great God** (**Mahādēvāya**), the **three-eyed one** (**Tryambakāya**), the **destroyer of the three cities** (**Tripurāntakāya**), the form of time/death (**Trikāgnikālāya**), the **Rudra who is the fire of time** (**Kālāgnirudrāya**), the **blue-throated one** (**Nīlakaṇṭhāya**), the **conqueror of death** (**Mṛtyuñjayāya**), the **Lord of All** (**Sarvēśvarāya**), the **ever-auspicious one** (**Sadāśivāya**), salutations to the glorious Great God (**Mahādēvāya**).

verses.original:
नमो॒ हिर॑ण्य बाहवे सेना॒न्ये॑ दि॒शा-ञ्च॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ वृ॒क्षेभ्यो॒ हरि॑केशेभ्यः पशू॒ना-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमः॑ स॒स्पिञ्ज॑राय॒ त्विषी॑मते पथी॒ना-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ बभ्लु॒शाय॑ विव्या॒धिने-ऽन्ना॑ना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॒ हरि॑केशायोपवी॒तिने॑ पु॒ष्टाना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ भ॒वस्य॑ हे॒त्यै जग॑ता॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ रु॒द्राया॑तता॒विने॒ क्षेत्रा॑णा॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नम॑स्सू॒तायाह॑न्त्याय॒ वना॑ना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॒ रोहि॑ताय स्थ॒पत॑ये वृ॒क्षाणा॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ म॒न्त्रिणे॑ वाणि॒जाय॒ कक्षा॑णा॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ भुव॒न्तये॑ वारिवस्कृ॒ता-यौष॑धीना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नम॑ उ॒च्चैर्घो॑षायाक्र॒न्दय॑ते पत्ती॒ना-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमः॑ कृत्स्नवी॒ताय॒ धाव॑ते॒ सत्त्व॑ना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥२॥
verses.transliteration:
namō̠ hira̍ṇya bāhavē sēnā̠nyē̍ di̠śā-ñcha̠ pata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̍ vṛ̠kṣēbhyō̠ hari̍kēśēbhyaḥ paśū̠nā-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
nama̍-ssa̠spiñja̍rāya̠ tviṣī̍matē pathī̠nā-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̍ babhlu̠śāya̍ vivyā̠dhinē-‘nnā̍nā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̠ hari̍kēśāyōpavī̠tinē̍ pu̠ṣṭānā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̍ bha̠vasya̍ hē̠tyai jaga̍tā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̍ ru̠drāyā̍tatā̠vinē̠ kṣētrā̍ṇā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
nama̍ssū̠tāyāha̍ntyāya̠ vanā̍nā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̠ rōhi̍tāya stha̠pata̍yē vṛ̠kṣāṇā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̍ ma̠ntriṇē̍ vāṇi̠jāya̠ kakṣā̍ṇā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
nama̍ u̠chchairghō̍ṣāyākra̠ndaya̍tē pattī̠nā-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
nama̍ḥ kṛtsnavī̠tāya̠ dhāva̍tē̠ sattva̍nā̠-mpata̍yē̠ nama̍ḥ ॥ 2 ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to the one with golden arms (Hiraṇyabāhu), the Commander of the Army (Sēnāni), and the Lord of the Directions (Diśām Pati). Salutations to the trees with green foliage (Harikēśēbhyaḥ) and the Lord of Cattle (Paśūnām Pati). Salutations to the one yellowish-green (Saspijñjara), radiant (Tviṣīmate), and the Lord of paths (Pathīnām Pati). Salutations to the brown one (Babhluśa), the afflicter (Vivyādhine), and the Lord of Food (Annānām Pati). Salutations to the green-haired one (Harikēśāya), who wears the sacred thread (Upavītine), and the Lord of the Prosperous (Puṣṭānām Pati).
Salutations to the striking force (Hēti) of Bhava, and the Lord of all creation (Jagatām Pati). Salutations to Rudra, the stretcher of the bow (Ātatāvine), and the Lord of fields (Kṣētrāṇām Pati). Salutations to the Charioteer (Sūta), the unassailable one (Ahantyāya), and the Lord of forests (Vanānām Pati). Salutations to the Red one (Rōhita), the Chief architect (Sthapataye), and the Lord of trees (Vṛkṣāṇām Pati). Salutations to the Counselor (Mantriṇe), the merchant (Vāṇijāya), and the Lord of thickets (Kakṣāṇām Pati). Salutations to the Lord of the world (Bhuvantaye), the giver of wealth (Vārivaskṛtāya), and the Lord of herbs (Auṣadhīnām Pati). Salutations to the one with the loud battle-cry (Uccairghoṣāya), who makes others cry (Ākrandayate), and the Lord of foot-soldiers (Pattīnām Pati). Salutations to the one completely enveloped (Kṛtsnavītāya), the runner (Dhāvate), and the Lord of brave men (Sattvanām Pati).

verses.original:
नम॒-स्सह॑मानाय निव्या॒धिन॑ आव्या॒धिनी॑ना॒-म्पत॑ये नमो॒
नमः॑ ककु॒भाय॑ निष॒ङ्गिणे᳚ स्ते॒नाना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ निष॒ङ्गिण॑ इषुधि॒मते॒ तस्क॑राणा॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॒ वञ्च॑ते परि॒वञ्च॑ते स्तायू॒ना-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ निचे॒रवे॑ परिच॒रायार॑ण्याना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमः॑ सृका॒विभ्यो॒ जिघाग्ं॑सद्भ्यो मुष्ण॒ता-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नमो॑-ऽसि॒मद्भ्यो॒ नक्त॒ञ्चर॑द्भ्यः प्रकृ॒न्ताना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नम॑ उष्णी॒षिणे॑ गिरिच॒राय॑ कुलु॒ञ्चाना॒-म्पत॑ये॒ नमो॒
नम॒ इषु॑मद्भ्यो धन्वा॒विभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॑ आतन्-वा॒नेभ्यः॑ प्रति॒दधा॑नेभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॑ आ॒यच्छ॑द्भ्यो विसृ॒जद्भ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो-ऽस्स॑द्भ्यो॒ विद्य॑द्भ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॒ आसी॑नेभ्य॒-श्शया॑नेभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमः॑ स्व॒पद्भ्यो॒ जाग्र॑द्भ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॒स्तिष्ठ॑द्भ्यो॒ धाव॑द्भ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमः॑ स॒भाभ्यः॑ स॒भाप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॒ अश्वे॒भ्यो-ऽश्व॑पतिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥३॥
verses.transliteration:
nama̠-ssaha̍mānāya nivyā̠dhina̍ āvyā̠dhinī̍nā̠-mpata̍yē namō̠
nama̍ḥ kaku̠bhāya̍ niṣa̠ṅgiṇē̎ stē̠nānā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̍ niṣa̠ṅgiṇa̍ iṣudhi̠matē̠ taska̍rāṇā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̠ vañcha̍tē pari̠vañcha̍tē stāyū̠nā-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̍ nichē̠ravē̍ paricha̠rāyāra̍ṇyānā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
nama̍-ssṛkā̠vibhyō̠ jighāg̍ṃsadbhyō muṣṇa̠tā-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
namō̍-‘si̠madbhyō̠ nakta̠ñchara̍dbhyaḥ prakṛ̠ntānā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
nama̍ uṣṇī̠ṣiṇē̍ giricha̠rāya̍ kulu̠ñchānā̠-mpata̍yē̠ namō̠
nama̠ iṣu̍madbhyō dhanvā̠vibhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̍ ātan-vā̠nēbhya̍ḥ prati̠dadhā̍nēbhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̍ ā̠yachCha̍dbhyō visṛ̠jadbhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
namō-‘ssa̍dbhyō̠ vidya̍dbhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̠ āsī̍nēbhya̠-śśayā̍nēbhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̍-ssva̠padbhyō̠ jāgra̍dbhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̠stiṣṭha̍dbhyō̠ dhāva̍dbhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̍-ssa̠bhābhya̍-ssa̠bhāpa̍tibhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
namō̠ aśvē̠bhyō-‘śva̍patibhyaścha vō̠ nama̍ḥ ॥ 3 ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to the victorious one (Sahamānāya), the striker (Nivyādhine), and the Lord of the attacking hordes (Āvyādhinīnām Pati). Salutations to the one on the summit (Kakubhāya), who wears a sword (Niṣaṅgiṇe), and the Lord of thieves (Stēnānām Pati).
Salutations to the one who wears a sword and carries a quiver (Iṣudhimate), and the Lord of robbers (Taskarāṇām Pati). Salutations to the cheater (Vanchate), the complete deceiver (Parivañcate), and the Lord of lurking thieves (Stāyūnām Pati). Salutations to the silent stalker (Nicerave), the wanderer (Paricarāya), and the Lord of forest-dwellers (Āraṇyānām Pati).
Salutations to those carrying swords (Sṛkāvibhyaḥ), those desirous of killing (Jighāgṃsadbhyaḥ), and the Lord of plunderers (Muṣṇatām Pati). Salutations to those bearing swords (Asimadbhyaḥ), those who roam at night (Naktañcaradbhyaḥ), and the Lord of cutthroats (Prakṛntānām Pati). Salutations to the turbaned one (Uṣṇīṣiṇe), the mountain-rover (Giricarāya), and the Lord of land-grabbers (Kuluñcānām Pati).
Salutations to you, who are archers (Iṣumadbhyaḥ) and bow-men (Dhanvāvibhyaḥ). Salutations to you, who string the bow (Ātanvānebhyaḥ) and those who aim (Pratidadhānebhyaśca). Salutations to you, who draw the arrow (Āyaccha-dbhyaḥ) and those who release it (Visṛjadbhyaśca). Salutations to you, who are sitting (Asadbhyaḥ) and those who are striking (Vidya-dbhyaśca).
Salutations to you, who are seated (Āsīnebhyaḥ) and those who are lying down (Śayānebhyaśca). Salutations to you, who are sleeping (Sva-padbhyaḥ) and those who are awake (Jāgra-dbhyaśca). Salutations to you, who are standing (Tiṣṭha-dbhyaḥ) and those who are running (Dhāva-dbhyaśca). Salutations to the assemblies (Sabhābhyaḥ) and the Lords of the assemblies (Sabhāpatibhyaśca). Salutations to the horses (Aśvebhyaḥ) and the masters of horses (Aśvapatibhyaśca).

verses.original:
नम॑ आव्या॒धिनी᳚भ्यो वि॒विध्य॑न्तीभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॒ उग॑णाभ्यस्तृग्ं-ह॒तीभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ गृ॒त्सेभ्यो॑ गृ॒त्सप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॒ व्राते᳚भ्यो॒ व्रात॑पतिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ ग॒णेभ्यो॑ ग॒णप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॒ विरू॑पेभ्यो वि॒श्वरू॑पेभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ मह॒द्भ्यः॑, क्षुल्ल॒केभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ र॒थिभ्यो॑-ऽर॒थेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॒ रथे᳚भ्यो॒ रथ॑पतिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॒-स्सेना᳚भ्य-स्सेना॒निभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमः॑, क्ष॒त्तृभ्यः॑ सङ्ग्रही॒तृभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॒स्तक्ष॑भ्यो रथका॒रेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमः॒ कुला॑लेभ्यः क॒र्मारे᳚भ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमः॑ पु॒ञ्जिष्टे᳚भ्यो निषा॒देभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॑ इषु॒कृद्भ्यो॑ धन्व॒कृद्भ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नमो॑ मृग॒युभ्यः॑ श्व॒निभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒
नम॒-श्श्वभ्य॒-श्श्वप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥४॥
verses.transliteration:
nama̍ āvyā̠dhinī̎bhyō vi̠vidhya̍ntībhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̠ uga̍ṇābhyastṛgṃ-ha̠tībhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
namō̍ gṛ̠tsēbhyō̍ gṛ̠tsapa̍tibhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
namō̠ vrātē̎bhyō̠ vrāta̍patibhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
namō̍ ga̠ṇēbhyō̍ ga̠ṇapa̍tibhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
namō̠ virū̍pēbhyō vi̠śvarū̍pēbhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
namō̍ maha̠dbhya̍ḥ, kṣulla̠kēbhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
namō̍ ra̠thibhyō̍-‘ra̠thēbhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
namō̠ rathē̎bhyō̠ ratha̍patibhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̠-ssēnā̎bhya-ssēnā̠nibhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̍ḥ, kṣa̠ttṛbhya̍-ssaṅgrahī̠tṛbhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̠stakṣa̍bhyō rathakā̠rēbhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̠ḥ kulā̍lēbhyaḥ ka̠rmārē̎bhyaścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̍ḥ pu̠ñjiṣṭē̎bhyō niṣā̠dēbhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̍ iṣu̠kṛdbhyō̍ dhanva̠kṛdbhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̍ḥ mṛga̠yubhya̍-śśva̠nibhya̍ścha vō̠ namō̠
nama̠-śśvabhya̠-śśvapa̍tibhyaścha vō̠ nama̍ḥ ॥ 4 ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to the attacking forces (Āvyādhinībhyaḥ) and the piercing forces (Vividhyantībhyas). Salutations to the fierce hosts (Ugaṇābhyaḥ) and the destroying forces (Tṛgṃhatībhyas). Salutations to the greedy ones (Gṛtsēbhyaḥ) and the leaders of the greedy (Gṛtsapatibhyas). Salutations to the wandering tribes (Vrātēbhyaḥ) and the leaders of the tribes (Vrātapati-bhyaśca). Salutations to the hosts (Gaṇēbhyaḥ) and the leaders of the hosts (Gaṇapatibhyaśca).
Salutations to the deformed ones (Virūpēbhyaḥ) and the multi-formed ones (Viśvarūpēbhyaśca). Salutations to the great ones (Mahadbhyaḥ) and the small ones (Kṣullakēbhyaśca). Salutations to the chariot-riders (Rathibhyaḥ) and those without chariots (Arathēbhyaśca). Salutations to the chariots (Rathēbhyaḥ) and the masters of chariots (Rathapatibhyaśca). Salutations to the armies (Sēnābhyaḥ) and the leaders of the armies (Sēnānibhyaśca).
Salutations to the car-drivers (Kṣattṛbhyaḥ) and the treasurers (Saṅgrahītṛbhyaśca). Salutations to the carpenters (Takṣabhyaḥ) and the chariot-makers (Rathakārēbhyaśca). Salutations to the potters (Kulālēbhyaḥ) and the blacksmiths (Karmārēbhyaśca). Salutations to the fowlers (Puñjiṣṭēbhyaḥ) and the fishermen (Niṣādēbhyaśca). Salutations to the arrow-makers (Iṣukṛdbhyaḥ) and the bow-makers (Dhanvakṛdbhyaśca). Salutations to the hunters (Mṛgayubhyaḥ) and the dog-keepers (Śvanibhyaśca). Salutations to the dogs (Śvabhyaḥ) and the masters of dogs (Śvapatibhyaśca).

verses.original:
नमो॑ भ॒वाय॑ च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒
नमः॑ श॒र्वाय॑ च पशु॒पत॑ये च॒
नमो॒ नील॑ग्रीवाय च शिति॒कण्ठा॑य च॒
नमः॑ कप॒र्दिने॑ च॒ व्यु॑प्तकेशाय च॒
नमः॑ सहस्रा॒क्षाय॑ च श॒तध॑न्वने च॒
नमो॑ गिरि॒शाय॑ च शिपिवि॒ष्टाय॑ च॒
नमो॑ मी॒ढुष्ट॑माय॒ चेषु॑मते च॒
नमो᳚ ह्र॒स्वाय॑ च वाम॒नाय॑ च॒
नमो॑ बृह॒ते च॒ वर्​षी॑यसे च॒
नमो॑ वृ॒द्धाय॑ च सं॒​वृँध्व॑ने च॒
नमो॒ अग्रि॑याय च प्रथ॒माय॑ च॒
नम॑ आ॒शवे॑ चाजि॒राय॑ च॒
नम॒-श्शीघ्रि॑याय च॒ शीभ्या॑य च॒
नम॑ ऊ॒र्म्या॑य चावस्व॒न्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ स्रोत॒स्या॑य च॒ द्वीप्या॑य च ॥५॥
verses.transliteration:
namō̍ bha̠vāya̍ cha ru̠drāya̍ cha̠
nama̍-śśa̠rvāya̍ cha paśu̠pata̍yē cha̠
namō̠ nīla̍grīvāya cha śiti̠kaṇṭhā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ḥ kapa̠rdinē̍ cha̠ vyu̍ptakēśāya cha̠
nama̍-ssahasrā̠kṣāya̍ cha śa̠tadha̍nvanē cha̠
namō̍ giri̠śāya̍ cha śipivi̠ṣṭāya̍ cha̠
namō̍ mī̠ḍhuṣṭa̍māya̠ chēṣu̍matē cha̠
namō̎ hra̠svāya̍ cha vāma̠nāya̍ cha̠
namō̍ bṛha̠tē cha̠ var​ṣī̍yasē cha̠
namō̍ vṛ̠ddhāya̍ cha sa̠ṃvṛdhva̍nē cha̠
namō̠ agri̍yāya cha pratha̠māya̍ cha̠
nama̍ ā̠śavē̍ chāji̠rāya̍ cha̠
nama̠-śśīghri̍yāya cha̠ śībhyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ ū̠rmyā̍ya chāvasva̠nyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍-ssrōta̠syā̍ya cha̠ dvīpyā̍ya cha ॥ 5 ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to Bhava and to Rudra. Salutations to Śarva and to Paśupati (Lord of creatures). Salutations to the Blue-throated (Nīlagrīvāya) and to the White-throated (Śitikaṇṭhāya). Salutations to the one with matted hair (Kapardine) and the one with shaven hair (Vyuptakēśāya).
Salutations to the thousand-eyed one (Sahasrākṣāya) and the one with a hundred bows (Śatadhanvane). Salutations to the dweller of the mountain (Giriśāya) and to Śipiviṣṭa (whose form is clothed in rays of light). Salutations to the most liberal bestower of wishes (Mīḍhuṣṭamāya) and the one with arrows (Iṣumate). Salutations to the short one (Hrasvāya) and the dwarf (Vāmanāya).
Salutations to the great one (Bṛhate) and the oldest (Varṣīyase). Salutations to the old one (Vṛddhāya) and the one who increases growth (Saṃvṛdhvane). Salutations to the foremost (Agriyāya) and the first (Prathamāya). Salutations to the swift one (Āśave) and the quick one (Ajirāya).
Salutations to the swift in action (Śīghriyāya) and the swift in motion (Śībhyāya). Salutations to the wave-dwelling one (Ūrmyāya) and the one dwelling in the waters (Avasvanyāya). Salutations to the one dwelling in streams (Srōtasyāya) and the one dwelling in islands (Dvīpyāya).

verses.original:
नमो᳚ ज्ये॒ष्ठाय॑ च कनि॒ष्ठाय॑ च॒
नमः॑ पूर्व॒जाय॑ चापर॒जाय॑ च॒
नमो॑ मध्य॒माय॑ चापग॒ल्भाय॑ च॒
नमो॑ जघ॒न्या॑य च॒ बुध्नि॑याय च॒
नमः॑ सो॒भ्या॑य च प्रतिस॒र्या॑य च॒
नमो॒ याम्या॑य च॒ क्षेम्या॑य च॒
नम॑ उर्व॒र्या॑य च॒ खल्या॑य च॒
नम॒-श्श्लोक्या॑य चा-ऽवसा॒न्या॑य च॒
नमो॒ वन्या॑य च॒ कक्ष्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ श्र॒वाय॑ च प्रतिश्र॒वाय॑ च॒
नम॑ आ॒शुषे॑णाय चा॒शुर॑थाय च॒
नम॒-श्शूरा॑य चावभिन्द॒ते च॒
नमो॑ व॒र्मिणे॑ च वरू॒धिने॑ च॒
नमो॑ बि॒ल्मिने॑ च कव॒चिने॑ च॒
नमः॑ श्रु॒ताय॑ च श्रुतसे॒नाय॑ च॥ ६॥
verses.transliteration:
namō̎ jyē̠ṣṭhāya̍ cha kani̠ṣṭhāya̍ cha̠
nama̍ḥ pūrva̠jāya̍ chāpara̠jāya̍ cha̠
namō̍ madhya̠māya̍ chāpaga̠lbhāya̍ cha̠
namō̍ jagha̠nyā̍ya cha̠ budhni̍yāya cha̠
nama̍-ssō̠bhyā̍ya cha pratisa̠ryā̍ya cha̠
namō̠ yāmyā̍ya cha̠ kṣēmyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ urva̠ryā̍ya cha̠ khalyā̍ya cha̠
nama̠-śślōkyā̍ya chā-‘vasā̠nyā̍ya cha̠
namō̠ vanyā̍ya cha̠ kakṣyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍-śśra̠vāya̍ cha pratiśra̠vāya̍ cha̠
nama̍ ā̠śuṣē̍ṇāya chā̠śura̍thāya cha̠
nama̠-śśūrā̍ya chāvabhinda̠tē cha̠
namō̍ va̠rmiṇē̍ cha varū̠dhinē̍ cha̠
namō̍ bi̠lminē̍ cha kava̠chinē̍ cha̠
nama̍-śśru̠tāya̍ cha śrutasē̠nāya̍ cha ॥ 6 ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to the eldest (Jyēṣṭhāya) and the youngest (Kaniṣṭhāya). Salutations to the one born before (Pūrvajāya) and the one born after (Aparajāya). Salutations to the middle one (Madhyamāya) and the simple one (Apagalbhāya). Salutations to the lowest one (Jaghanyāya) and the foundational one (Budhniyāya).
Salutations to the one in the assembly (Sōbhyāya) and the one who moves forward (Pratisaryāya). Salutations to the one in the right direction (Yāmyāya) and the one in the safe land (Kṣēmyāya). Salutations to the one in the fertile land (Urvaryāya) and the one in the threshing floor (Khalyāya). Salutations to the one in the hymn (Ślōkyāya) and the one in the final moment (Avasānyāya).
Salutations to the one in the forest (Vanyāya) and the one in the thicket (Kakṣyāya). Salutations to the sound (Śravāya) and the echo (Pratiśravāya). Salutations to the one with a swift army (Āśuṣēṇāya) and the one with a swift chariot (Āśurathāya). Salutations to the hero (Śūrāya) and the destroyer of opponents (Avabhindate).
Salutations to the mail-clad one (Varmiṇe) and the one with a shield (Varūdhine). Salutations to the helmeted one (Bilmine) and the armored one (Kavachine). Salutations to the renowned one (Śrutāya) and the one with a famous army (Śrutasēnāya).

verses.original:

नम॒-स्सूद्या॑य च सर॒स्या॑य च॒

नमः॒ कूप्या॑य चाव॒ट्या॑य च॒
नमो॒ वर्​ष्या॑य चाव॒र्​ष्याय॑ च॒
नमो॑ मे॒घ्या॑य च विद्यु॒त्या॑य च॒
नम ई॒ध्रिया॑य चात॒प्या॑य च॒

नमो॑ वास्त॒व्या॑य च वास्तु॒पाय॑ च ॥ ७॥
verses.transliteration:
namō̍ dundu̠bhyā̍ya chāhana̠nyā̍ya cha̠
namō̍ dhṛ̠ṣṇavē̍ cha pramṛ̠śāya̍ cha̠
namō̍ dū̠tāya̍ cha prahi̍tāya cha̠
namō̍ niṣa̠ṅgiṇē̍ chēṣudhi̠matē̍ cha̠
nama̍stī̠kṣṇēṣa̍vē chāyu̠dhinē̍ cha̠
nama̍-ssvāyu̠dhāya̍ cha su̠dhanva̍nē cha̠
nama̠-ssrutyā̍ya cha̠ pathyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ḥ kā̠ṭyā̍ya cha nī̠pyā̍ya cha̠
nama̠-ssūdyā̍ya cha sara̠syā̍ya cha̠
namō̍ nā̠dyāya̍ cha vaiśa̠ntāya̍ cha̠
nama̠ḥ kūpyā̍ya chāva̠ṭyā̍ya cha̠
namō̠ var​ṣyā̍ya chāva̠r​ṣyāya̍ cha̠
namō̍ mē̠ghyā̍ya cha vidyu̠tyā̍ya cha̠
nama ī̠dhriyā̍ya chāta̠pyā̍ya cha̠
namō̠ vātyā̍ya cha̠ rēṣmi̍yāya cha̠
namō̍ vāsta̠vyā̍ya cha vāstu̠pāya̍ cha ॥ 7 ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to the one in the kettle-drum (Dundubhyāya) and the one in the drum-stick (Āhananyāya). Salutations to the daring one (Dhṛṣṇave) and the spy (Pramṛśāya). Salutations to the messenger (Dūtāya) and the appointed one (Prahitāya). Salutations to the one who wears a sword (Niṣaṅgiṇe) and the one who carries a quiver (Iṣudhimatē).
Salutations to the one with sharp arrows (Tīkṣṇēṣave) and the one with weapons (Āyudhine). Salutations to the one with excellent weapons (Svāyudhāya) and the one with a good bow (Sudhanvane). Salutations to the one in the watercourse (Srutyāya) and the one in the path (Pathyāya). Salutations to the one in the precipice (Kāṭyāya) and the one in the lowland (Nīpyāya).
Salutations to the one in the marshy ground (Sūdyāya) and the one in the lake (Sarasyāya). Salutations to the one in the river (Nādyāya) and the one in the pool (Vaiśantāya). Salutations to the one in the well (Kūpyāya) and the one in the pit (Avaṭyāya).
Salutations to the one in the rain (Varṣyāya) and the one in the drought (Avarṣyāya). Salutations to the one in the cloud (Mēghyāya) and the one in the lightning (Vidyutyāya). Salutations to the one in the hail (Īdhriyāya) and the one in the sun's heat (Ātapyāya). Salutations to the one in the wind (Vātyāya) and the one in the whirlwind (Rēṣmiyāya). Salutations to the one in the household (Vāstavyāya) and the guardian of the dwelling (Vāstupāya).

verses.original:
नम॒-स्सोमा॑य च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒
नम॑स्ता॒म्राय॑ चारु॒णाय॑ च॒
नमः॑ श॒ङ्गाय॑ च पशु॒पत॑ये च॒
नम॑ उ॒ग्राय॑ च भी॒माय॑ च॒
नमो॑ अग्रेव॒धाय॑ च दूरेव॒धाय॑ च॒
नमो॑ ह॒न्त्रे च॒ हनी॑यसे च॒
नमो॑ वृ॒क्षेभ्यो॒ हरि॑केशेभ्यो॒
नम॑स्ता॒राय॒
नम॑श्श॒म्भवे॑ च मयो॒भवे॑ च॒
नमः॑ शङ्क॒राय॑ च मयस्क॒राय॑ च॒
नमः॑ शि॒वाय॑ च शि॒वत॑राय च॒
नम॒स्तीर्थ्या॑य च॒ कूल्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ पा॒र्या॑य चावा॒र्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ प्र॒तर॑णाय चो॒त्तर॑णाय च॒
नम॑ आता॒र्या॑य चाला॒द्या॑य च॒
नम॒-श्शष्प्या॑य च॒ फेन्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ सिक॒त्या॑य च प्रवा॒ह्या॑य च ॥ ८॥
verses.transliteration:
nama̠-ssōmā̍ya cha ru̠drāya̍ cha̠
nama̍stā̠mrāya̍ chāru̠ṇāya̍ cha̠
nama̍-śśa̠ṅgāya̍ cha paśu̠pata̍yē cha̠
nama̍ u̠grāya̍ cha bhī̠māya̍ cha̠
namō̍ agrēva̠dhāya̍ cha dūrēva̠dhāya̍ cha̠
namō̍ ha̠ntrē cha̠ hanī̍yasē cha̠
namō̍ vṛ̠kṣēbhyō̠ hari̍kēśēbhyō̠
nama̍stā̠rāya̠
nama̍śśa̠mbhavē̍ cha mayō̠bhavē̍ cha̠
nama̍-śśaṅka̠rāya̍ cha mayaska̠rāya̍ cha̠
nama̍-śśi̠vāya̍ cha śi̠vata̍rāya cha̠
nama̠stīrthyā̍ya cha̠ kūlyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ḥ pā̠ryā̍ya chāvā̠ryā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ḥ pra̠tara̍ṇāya chō̠ttara̍ṇāya cha̠
nama̍ ātā̠ryā̍ya chālā̠dyā̍ya cha̠
nama̠-śśaṣpyā̍ya cha̠ phēnyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍-ssika̠tyā̍ya cha pravā̠hyā̍ya cha ॥ 8 ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to Sōma (with) and Rudra. Salutations to the copper-red (Tāmrāya) and the reddish-brown (Aruṇāya). Salutations to Śaṅga (the giver of joy) and Paśupati (Lord of creatures). Salutations to the fierce one (Ugrāya) and the terrible one (Bhīmāya).
Salutations to the slayer in front (Agrēvadhāya) and the slayer from a distance (Dūrēvadhāya). Salutations to the slayer (Hantre) and the more dreadful slayer (Hanīyase). Salutations to the trees with green foliage (Harikēśēbhyaḥ). Salutations to the deliverer (Tārāya).
Salutations to Śambhu (source of happiness) and Mayōbhava (source of delight). Salutations to Śaṅkara (giver of welfare) and Mayaskaraya (maker of delight). Salutations to Śiva (the auspicious one) and Śivatara (the most auspicious). Salutations to the one in sacred bathing places (Tīrthyāya) and the one on the bank (Kūlyāya).
Salutations to the one on the farther shore (Pāryāya) and the one on the nearer shore (Avāryāya). Salutations to the one who helps cross over (Prataraṇāya) and the one who helps ascend (Uttaraṇāya). Salutations to the one who makes others cross over (Ātāryāya) and the one who moves everywhere (Ālādyāya).
Salutations to the one in the tender grass (Śaṣpyāya) and the one in the foam (Phēnyāya). Salutations to the one in the sand (Sikatyāya) and the one in the swiftly flowing water (Pravāhyāya).

verses.original:
नम॑ इरि॒ण्या॑य च प्रप॒थ्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ किग्ंशि॒लाय॑ च॒ क्षय॑णाय च॒
नमः॑ कप॒र्दिने॑ च पुल॒स्तये॑ च॒
नमो॒ गोष्ठ्या॑य च॒ गृह्या॑य च॒
नम॒स्तल्प्या॑य च॒ गेह्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ का॒ट्या॑य च गह्वरे॒ष्ठाय॑ च॒
नमो᳚ ह्रद॒य्या॑य च निवे॒ष्प्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ पाग्ं स॒व्या॑य च रज॒स्या॑य च॒
नम॒-श्शुष्क्या॑य च हरि॒त्या॑य च॒
नमो॒ लोप्या॑य चोल॒प्या॑य च॒
नम॑ ऊ॒र्व्या॑य च सू॒र्म्या॑य च॒
नमः॑ प॒र्ण्या॑य च पर्णश॒द्या॑य च॒
नमो॑-ऽपगु॒रमा॑णाय चाभिघ्न॒ते च॒
नम॑ आख्खिद॒ते च॑ प्रख्खिद॒ते च॒
नमो॑ वः किरि॒केभ्यो॑ दे॒वाना॒ग्॒म्॒ हृद॑येभ्यो॒
नमो॑ विक्षीण॒केभ्यो॒ नमो॑ विचिन्व॒त्केभ्यो॒
नम॑ आनिर् ह॒तेभ्यो॒ नम॑ आमीव॒त्केभ्यः॑ ॥ ९॥
verses.transliteration:
nama̍ iri̠ṇyā̍ya cha prapa̠thyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ḥ kigṃśi̠lāya̍ cha̠ kṣaya̍ṇāya cha̠
nama̍ḥ kapa̠rdinē̍ cha pula̠stayē̍ cha̠
namō̠ gōṣṭhyā̍ya cha̠ gṛhyā̍ya cha̠
nama̠stalpyā̍ya cha̠ gēhyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ḥ kā̠ṭyā̍ya cha gahvarē̠ṣṭhāya̍ cha̠
namō̎ hrada̠yyā̍ya cha nivē̠ṣpyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ḥ pāgṃ sa̠vyā̍ya cha raja̠syā̍ya cha̠
nama̠-śśuṣkyā̍ya cha hari̠tyā̍ya cha̠
namō̠ lōpyā̍ya chōla̠pyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ ū̠rvyā̍ya cha sū̠rmyā̍ya cha̠
nama̍ḥ pa̠rṇyā̍ya cha parṇaśa̠dyā̍ya cha̠
namō̍-‘pagu̠ramā̍ṇāya chābhighna̠tē cha̠
nama̍ ākhkhida̠tē cha̍ prakhkhida̠tē cha̠
namō̍ vaḥ kiri̠kēbhyō̍ dē̠vānā̠g̠m̠ hṛda̍yēbhyō̠
namō̍ vikṣīṇa̠kēbhyō̠ namō̍ vichinva̠tkēbhyō̠
nama̍ ānir ha̠tēbhyō̠ nama̍ āmīva̠tkēbhya̍ḥ ॥ 9 ॥
verses.translation:
Salutations to the one in the barren land (Iriṇyāya) and the one in the public road (Prapathyāya). Salutations to the one in the pebbly ground (Kiṃśilāya) and the one in the dwelling (Kṣayaṇāya). Salutations to the matted-haired one (Kapardine) and the sage Pulastya (Pulastaye). Salutations to the one in the cow-shed (Gōṣṭhyāya) and the one in the home (Gṛhyāya).
Salutations to the one on the couch (Talpyāya) and the one in the house (Gēhyāya). Salutations to the one in the narrow path (Kāṭyāya) and the one in the deep cave (Gahvarēṣṭhāya). Salutations to the one in the deep waters (Hradayyāya) and the one in the whirlpools (Nivēṣpyāya). Salutations to the one in the sandy places (Pāgṃsavyāya) and the one in the dusty places (Rajasyāya).
Salutations to the one in the dry regions (Śuṣkyāya) and the one in the green regions (Harityāya). Salutations to the one in the neglected field (Lōpyāya) and the one in the abundant grass (Ulapyāya). Salutations to the one in the wide earth (Ūrvyāya) and the one in the good path (Sūrmyāya).
Salutations to the one in the leaves (Parṇyāya) and the one in the leaf-litter (Parṇaśadyāya). Salutations to the one who is concealed (Apaguramāṇāya) and the one who strikes (Abhignate). Salutations to the one who torments (Ākhkhidate) and the one who terrifies (Prakhkhidate). Salutations to you, the scattered ones (Kirikēbhyaḥ), who are the hearts of the gods.
Salutations to those who waste away (Vikṣīṇakēbhyaḥ). Salutations to those who investigate (Vicinvatkēbhyaḥ). Salutations to the fully killed ones (Ānirhatēbhyaḥ). Salutations to those who cause sickness (Āmīvatkēbhyaḥ).

verses.original:
द्रापे॒ अन्ध॑सस्पते॒ दरि॑द्र॒न्नील॑लोहित ।
ए॒षा-म्पुरु॑षाणामे॒षा-म्प॑शू॒ना-म्मा भेर्मा-ऽरो॒ मो ए॑षा॒-ङ्किञ्च॒नाम॑मत् ।
या ते॑ रुद्र शि॒वा त॒नू-श्शि॒वा वि॒श्वाह॑भेषजी ।
शि॒वा रु॒द्रस्य॑ भेष॒जी तया॑ नो मृड जी॒वसे᳚ ॥
इ॒माग्ं रु॒द्राय॑ त॒वसे॑ कप॒र्दिने᳚ क्ष॒यद्वी॑राय॒ प्रभ॑रामहे म॒तिम् ।
यथा॑ न॒श्शमस॑द्द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे॒ विश्व॑-म्पु॒ष्ट-ङ्ग्रामे॑ अ॒स्मिन्नना॑तुरम् ।
मृ॒डा नो॑ रुद्रो॒त नो॒ मय॑स्कृधि क्ष॒यद्वी॑राय॒ नम॑सा विधेम ते ।
यच्छ-ञ्च॒ योश्च॒ मनु॑राय॒जे पि॒ता तद॑श्याम॒ तव॑ रुद्र॒ प्रणी॑तौ ।
मा नो॑ म॒हान्त॑मु॒त मा नो॑ अर्भ॒क-म्मा न॒ उक्ष॑न्तमु॒त मा न॑ उक्षि॒तम् ।
मा नो॑-ऽवधीः पि॒तर॒-म्मोत मा॒तर॑-म्प्रि॒या मा न॑स्त॒नुवो॑ रुद्र रीरिषः ।
मा न॑स्तो॒के तन॑ये॒ मा न॒ आयु॑षि॒ मा नो॒ गोषु॒ मा नो॒ अश्वे॑षु रीरिषः ।
वी॒रान्मा नो॑ रुद्र भामि॒तो-ऽव॑धीर्​ह॒विष्मं॑तो॒ नम॑सा विधेम ते ।
आ॒रात्ते॑ गो॒घ्न उ॒त पू॑रुष॒घ्ने क्ष॒यद्वी॑राय सु॒म्नम॒स्मे ते॑ अस्तु ।
रक्षा॑ च नो॒ अधि॑ च देव ब्रू॒ह्यथा॑ च न॒-श्शर्म॑ यच्छ द्वि॒बर्​हाः᳚ ।
स्तु॒हि श्रु॒त-ङ्ग॑र्त॒सदं॒-युँवा॑न-म्मृ॒गन्न भी॒ममु॑पह॒न्तुमु॒ग्रम् ।
मृ॒डा ज॑रि॒त्रे रु॑द्र॒ स्तवा॑नो अ॒न्यन्ते॑ अ॒स्मन्निव॑पन्तु॒ सेनाः᳚ ।
परि॑णो रु॒द्रस्य॑ हे॒तिर्वृ॑णक्तु॒ परि॑ त्वे॒षस्य॑ दुर्म॒ति र॑घा॒योः ।
अव॑ स्थि॒रा म॒घव॑द्भ्य-स्तनुष्व॒ मीढ्व॑स्तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय मृडय ।
मीढु॑ष्टम॒ शिव॑तम शि॒वो नः॑ सु॒मना॑ भव ।
प॒र॒मे वृ॒क्ष आयु॑धन्नि॒धाय॒ कृत्तिं॒-वँसा॑न॒ आच॑र॒ पिना॑क॒-म्बिभ्र॒दाग॑हि ।
विकि॑रिद॒ विलो॑हित॒ नम॑स्ते अस्तु भगवः ।
यास्ते॑ स॒हस्रग्ं॑ हे॒तयो॒न्यम॒स्मन्निव॑पन्तु॒ ताः ।
स॒हस्रा॑णि सहस्र॒धा बा॑हु॒वोस्तव॑ हे॒तयः॑ ।
तासा॒मीशा॑नो भगवः परा॒चीना॒ मुखा॑ कृधि ॥ १०॥
verses.transliteration:
drāpē̠ andha̍saspatē̠ dari̍dra̠nnīla̍lōhita ।
ē̠ṣā-mpuru̍ṣāṇāmē̠ṣā-mpa̍śū̠nā-mmā bhērmā-‘rō̠ mō ē̍ṣā̠-ṅkiñcha̠nāma̍mat ।
yā tē̍ rudra śi̠vā ta̠nū-śśi̠vā vi̠śvāha̍bhēṣajī ।
śi̠vā ru̠drasya̍ bhēṣa̠jī tayā̍ nō mṛḍa jī̠vasē̎ ॥
i̠māgṃ ru̠drāya̍ ta̠vasē̍ kapa̠rdinē̎ kṣa̠yadvī̍rāya̠ prabha̍rāmahē ma̠tim ।
yathā̍ na̠śśamasa̍ddvi̠padē̠ chatu̍ṣpadē̠ viśva̍-mpu̠ṣṭa-ṅgrāmē̍ a̠sminnanā̍turam ।
mṛ̠ḍā nō̍ rudrō̠ta nō̠ maya̍skṛdhi kṣa̠yadvī̍rāya̠ nama̍sā vidhēma tē ।
yachCha-ñcha̠ yōścha̠ manu̍rāya̠jē pi̠tā tada̍śyāma̠ tava̍ rudra̠ praṇī̍tau ।
mā nō̍ ma̠hānta̍mu̠ta mā nō̍ arbha̠ka-mmā na̠ ukṣa̍ntamu̠ta mā na̍ ukṣi̠tam ।
mā nō̍-‘vadhīḥ pi̠tara̠-mmōta mā̠tara̍-mpri̠yā mā na̍sta̠nuvō̍ rudra rīriṣaḥ ।
māna̍stō̠kē tana̍yē̠ mā na̠ āyu̍ṣi̠ mā nō̠ gōṣu̠ mā nō̠ aśvē̍ṣu rīriṣaḥ ।
vī̠rānmā nō̍ rudra bhāmi̠tō-‘va̍dhīr​ha̠viṣmaṃ̍tō̠ nama̍sā vidhēma tē ।
ā̠rāttē̍ gō̠ghna u̠ta pū̍ruṣa̠ghnē kṣa̠yadvī̍rāya su̠mnama̠smē tē̍ astu ।
rakṣā̍ cha nō̠ adhi̍ cha dēva brū̠hyathā̍ cha na̠-śśarma̍ yachcha dvi̠bar​hā̎ḥ ।
stu̠hi śru̠ta-ṅga̍rta̠sada̠ṃ yuvā̍na-mmṛ̠ganna bhī̠mamu̍paha̠ntumu̠gram ।
mṛ̠ḍā ja̍ri̠trē ru̍dra̠ stavā̍nō a̠nyantē̍ a̠smanniva̍pantu̠ sēnā̎ḥ ।
pari̍ṇō ru̠drasya̍ hē̠tirvṛ̍ṇaktu̠ pari̍ tvē̠ṣasya̍ durma̠ti ra̍ghā̠yōḥ ।
ava̍ sthi̠rā ma̠ghava̍dbhya-stanuṣva̠ mīḍhva̍stō̠kāya̠ tana̍yāya mṛḍaya ।
mīḍhu̍ṣṭama̠ śiva̍tama śi̠vō na̍-ssu̠manā̍ bhava ।
pa̠ra̠mē vṛ̠kṣa āyu̍dhanni̠dhāya̠ kṛtti̠ṃ vasā̍na̠ ācha̍ra̠ pinā̍ka̠-mbibhra̠dāga̍hi ।
viki̍rida̠ vilō̍hita̠ nama̍stē astu bhagavaḥ ।
yāstē̍ sa̠hasragṃ̍ hē̠tayō̠nyama̠smanniva̍pantu̠ tāḥ ।
sa̠hasrā̍ṇi sahasra̠dhā bā̍hu̠vōstava̍ hē̠taya̍ḥ ।
tāsā̠mīśā̍nō bhagavaḥ parā̠chīnā̠ mukhā̍ kṛdhi ॥ 10 ॥
verses.translation:
O Drāpē (evil dispeller), O Lord of food (Andhasaspate), O poor one (Daridran), O blue and red one (Nīlalōhita)! May there be no fear for these men and these cattle; may none of them suffer any harm.
O Rudra, your form which is auspicious, which is benign, which is the panacea for all the world, which is the remedy of Rudra—with that, be gracious to us for our life.
We offer this prayer with devotion to the powerful Rudra, the matted-haired one (Kapardin), the destroyer of enemies (Kṣayadvīrāya), so that there may be welfare for our two-footed and four-footed creatures, and all prosperity and health in this village.
O Rudra, be gracious to us and bestow happiness upon us. We worship you, the destroyer of enemies, with salutations. May we attain that happiness and peace which Manu, our father, attained when he worshipped. 
Do not slay our great ones, nor our little ones, nor our growing ones, nor our grown ones. O Rudra, do not slay our father, nor our mother, nor our dear bodies. O Rudra, do not harm our children, nor our grandchildren, nor our lives, nor our cows, nor our horses.
O Rudra, in your anger, do not slay our heroes. We worship you, the offerer of oblations, with salutations. May your blessing be with us, O destroyer of enemies, which averts the slayer of cows and the slayer of men.
Protect us and speak favorably for us, O God, and grant us a refuge that is widespread. Praise the renowned one, the mountain-dweller (Gartasadam), the youth (Yuvānam), who is terrible like a tiger, fierce to attack. O Rudra, be gracious to the supplicator, may your armies be turned away from us and slay others.
May the striking force of Rudra avoid us, and may the fierce malice of the hateful one pass us by. Withdraw your steady arrows from the wealthy worshippers. O bountiful one, be kind to our children and grandchildren. 
O most bountiful (Mīḍhuṣṭama), most auspicious (Śivatama), be auspicious and kind to us. Having placed your weapon on the highest tree, come, clothed in your skin, holding your Pināka (bow). 
O scatterer of evil (Vikirida), O blood-red one (Vilōhita), salutations to you, O Bhagavan. May your thousand weapons be directed away from us. Your thousands upon thousands of weapons are on your two arms. O Bhagavan, the ruler of them, make their faces turn away (from us).

verses.original:
स॒हस्रा॑णि सहस्र॒शो ये रु॒द्रा अधि॒ भूम्या᳚म् ।
तेषाग्ं॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने-ऽव॒धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।
अ॒स्मिन्म॑ह॒त्य॑र्ण॒वें᳚-ऽतरि॑क्षे भ॒वा अधि॑ ।
नील॑ग्रीवा-श्शिति॒कण्ठा᳚-श्श॒र्वा अ॒धः, क्ष॑माच॒राः ।
नील॑ग्रीवा-श्शिति॒कण्ठा॒ दिवग्ं॑ रु॒द्रा उप॑श्रिताः ।
ये वृ॒क्षेषु॑ स॒स्पिञ्ज॑रा॒ नील॑ग्रीवा॒ विलो॑हिताः ।
ये भू॒ताना॒मधि॑पतयो विशि॒खासः॑ कप॒र्दि॑नः ।
ये अन्ने॑षु वि॒विध्य॑न्ति॒ पात्रे॑षु॒ पिब॑तो॒ जनान्॑ ।
ये प॒था-म्प॑थि॒रक्ष॑य ऐलबृ॒दा॑ य॒व्युधः॑ ।
ये ती॒र्थानि॑ प्र॒चर॑न्ति सृ॒काव॑न्तो निष॒ङ्गिणः॑ ।
य ए॒ताव॑न्तश्च॒ भूयाग्ं॑सश्च॒ दिशो॑ रु॒द्रा वि॑तस्थि॒रे ।
तेषाग्ं॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने-ऽव॒धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।
नमो॑ रु॒ध्रेभ्यो॒ ये पृ॑थि॒व्यां-येँ᳚-ऽन्तरि॑क्षे॒ ये दि॒वि येषा॒मन्नं॒-वाँतो॑ व॒र्​ष॒मिष॑व॒स्तेभ्यो॒ दश॒ प्राची॒र्दश॑ दक्षि॒णा दश॑ प्र॒तीची॒-र्दशो-दी॑ची॒-र्दशो॒र्ध्वास्तेभ्यो॒ नम॒स्ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते य-न्द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तं-वोँ॒ जम्भे॑ दधामि॥ ११॥
verses.transliteration:
sa̠hasrā̍ṇi sahasra̠śō yē ru̠drā adhi̠ bhūmyā̎m ।
tēṣāg̍ṃ sahasrayōja̠nē-‘va̠dhanvā̍ni tanmasi ।
a̠sminma̍ha̠tya̍rṇa̠vē̎m-‘tari̍kṣē bha̠vā adhi̍ ।
nīla̍grīvā-śśiti̠kaṇṭhā̎-śśa̠rvā a̠dhaḥ, kṣa̍mācha̠rāḥ ।
nīla̍grīvā-śśiti̠kaṇṭhā̠ divag̍ṃ ru̠drā upa̍śritāḥ ।
yē vṛ̠kṣēṣu̍ sa̠spiñja̍rā̠ nīla̍grīvā̠ vilō̍hitāḥ ।
yē bhū̠tānā̠madhi̍patayō viśi̠khāsa̍ḥ kapa̠rdi̍naḥ ।
yē annē̍ṣu vi̠vidhya̍nti̠ pātrē̍ṣu̠ piba̍tō̠ janān̍ ।
yē pa̠thā-mpa̍thi̠rakṣa̍ya ailabṛ̠dā̍ ya̠vyudha̍ḥ ।
yē tī̠rthāni̍ pra̠chara̍nti sṛ̠kāva̍ntō niṣa̠ṅgiṇa̍ḥ ।
ya ē̠tāva̍ntaścha̠ bhūyāg̍ṃsaścha̠ diśō̍ ru̠drā vi̍tasthi̠rē ।
tēṣāg̍ṃ sahasrayōja̠nē-‘va̠dhanvā̍ni tanmasi ।
namō̍ ru̠dhrēbhyō̠ yē pṛ̍thi̠vyāṃ yē̎-‘ntari̍kṣē̠ yē di̠vi yēṣā̠manna̠ṃ vātō̍ va̠r​ṣa̠miṣa̍va̠stēbhyō̠ daśa̠ prāchī̠rdaśa̍ dakṣi̠ṇā daśa̍ pra̠tīchī̠-rdaśō-dī̍chī̠-rdaśō̠rdhvāstēbhyō̠ nama̠stē nō̍ mṛḍayantu̠ tē ya-ndvi̠ṣmō yaścha̍ nō̠ dvēṣṭi̠ taṃ vō̠ jambhē̍ dadhāmi ॥ 11 ॥
verses.translation:
Thousands and thousands of Rudras who dwell upon the earth—we unstring the bows of those Rudras a thousand Yojanas away. Bhava and Śarva, blue-necked and white-throated, who dwell in this great ocean, in the mid-region, and who walk upon the earth below. 
The Rudras, blue-necked and white-throated, who are dependent on the heaven. Those Rudras who are yellowish-green like tender grass on the trees, blue-necked and blood-red. Those who are the Lords of all beings, shaven-headed or matted-haired (Kapardin).
Those who strike men while they are eating and drinking from vessels. Those who are the protectors of paths (Pathirakṣaya), givers of food (Ailabṛdā), and slayers of enemies (Yavyudhaḥ). Those who roam in the sacred bathing places (Tīrthāni), carrying swords (Sṛkāvantaḥ) and quivers (Niṣaṅgiṇaḥ).
To those Rudras—who are this many and more—who are spread throughout the directions, we unstring their bows a thousand Yojanas away. Salutations to the Rudras, those who are on the earth, those in the mid-region, and those in the heaven, whose food is sustenance, whose wind is wind, and whose arrows are rain—to them, ten salutations to the East, ten to the South, ten to the West, ten to the North, and ten upwards. Salutations to them! May they be gracious to us. The one whom we hate, and the one who hates us—him, we place into your jaws.

verses.original:
त्र्य॑म्बकं-यँजामहे सुग॒न्धि-म्पु॑ष्टि॒वर्ध॑नम् ।
उ॒र्वा॒रु॒कमि॑व॒ बन्ध॑नान्मृत्यो॑र्मुक्षीय॒ मा-ऽमृता᳚त् ।
यो रु॒द्रो अ॒ग्नौ यो अ॒प्सु य ओष॑धीषु॒ यो रु॒द्रो विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना वि॒वेश॒ तस्मै॑ रु॒द्राय॒ नमो॑ अस्तु ।
तमु॑ ष्टु॒हि॒ य-स्स्वि॒षुस्सु॒धन्वा॒ यो विश्व॑स्य॒ क्षय॑ति भेष॒जस्य॑ ।
यक्ष्वा᳚म॒हे सौ᳚मन॒साय॑ रु॒द्र-न्नमो᳚भिर्दे॒वमसु॑र-न्दुवस्य ।
अ॒य-म्मे॒ हस्तो॒ भग॑वान॒य-म्मे॒ भग॑वत्तरः ।
अ॒य-म्मे᳚ वि॒श्वभे᳚षजो॒-ऽयग्ं शि॒वाभि॑मर्​शनः ।
ये ते॑ स॒हस्र॑म॒युत॒-म्पाशा॒ मृत्यो॒ मर्त्या॑य॒ हन्त॑वे ।
तान् य॒ज्ञस्य॑ मा॒यया॒ सर्वा॒नव॑ यजामहे ।
मृ॒त्यवे॒ स्वाहा॑ मृ॒त्यवे॒ स्वाहा᳚ ॥ ११॥
ओ-न्नमो भगवते रुद्राय विष्णवे मृत्यु॑र्मे पा॒हि ॥
प्राणाना-ङ्ग्रन्थिरसि रुद्रो मा॑ विशा॒न्तकः ।
तेनान्नैना᳚प्य॒ायस्व ॥
नमो रुद्राय विष्णवे मृत्यु॑र्मे पा॒हि ॥
सदाशि॒वोम् ।
ॐ शान्ति॒-श्शान्ति॒-श्शान्तिः॑ ।
verses.transliteration:
trya̍mbakaṃ yajāmahē suga̠ndhi-mpu̍ṣṭi̠vardha̍nam ।
u̠rvā̠ru̠kami̍va̠ bandha̍nānmṛtyō̍rmukṣīya̠ mā-‘mṛtā̎t ।
yō ru̠drō a̠gnau yō a̠psu ya ōṣa̍dhīṣu̠ yō ru̠drō viśvā̠ bhuva̍nā vi̠vēśa̠ tasmai̍ ru̠drāya̠ namō̍ astu ।
tamu̍ ṣṭu̠hi̠ ya-ssvi̠ṣussu̠dhanvā̠ yō viśva̍sya̠ kṣaya̍ti bhēṣa̠jasya̍ ।
yakṣvā̎ma̠hē sau̎mana̠sāya̍ ru̠dra-nnamō̎bhirdē̠vamasu̍ra-nduvasya ।
a̠ya-mmē̠ hastō̠ bhaga̍vāna̠ya-mmē̠ bhaga̍vattaraḥ ।
a̠ya-mmē̎ vi̠śvabhē̎ṣajō̠-‘yagṃ śi̠vābhi̍mar​śanaḥ ।
yē tē̍ sa̠hasra̍ma̠yuta̠-mpāśā̠ mṛtyō̠ martyā̍ya̠ hanta̍vē ।
tān ya̠jñasya̍ mā̠yayā̠ sarvā̠nava̍ yajāmahē ।
mṛ̠tyavē̠ svāhā̍ mṛ̠tyavē̠ svāhā̎ ॥ 11 ॥
ō-nnamō bhagavatē rudrāya viṣṇavē mṛtyu̍rmē pā̠hi ॥
prāṇānā-ṅgranthirasi rudrō mā̍ viśā̠ntakaḥ ।
tēnānnēnā̎pyāya̠sva ॥
namō rudrāya viṣṇavē mṛtyu̍rmē pā̠hi ॥
sadāśi̠vōm ।
ōṃ śānti̠-śśānti̠-śśānti̍ḥ ।
verses.translation:
We worship Tryambaka (the three-eyed one), the fragrant (Sugandhim) and the cherisher of prosperity (Puṣṭivardhanam). May I be freed from the bondage of death, like a cucumber from its stalk, but not from immortality. 
That Rudra who is in the fire (Agni), who is in the waters (Apsu), who is in the herbs (Oṣadhīṣu), that Rudra who has entered all the worlds (Bhuvana)—to that Rudra be salutation. 
Praise him, who has good arrows, a good bow, and who dispels the disease of the whole world. Let us worship Rudra for peace of mind, let us worship the divine power with salutations. 
This hand of mine is blessed, this hand of mine is more blessed. This hand of mine is a universal panacea, this is a soothing touch. 
The thousands, the ten thousands of snares of Mṛtyu (death) to strike mortals—all those, we loosen through the power of the Yajña. Svāhā to Mṛtyu, Svāhā to Mṛtyu. 
Om, salutations to the venerable Rudra, who is Viṣṇu. Protect me from death. 
You are the knot of the vital breaths; may Rudra, the destroyer, not enter me. With that food, may you be nourished. Salutations to Rudra, who is Viṣṇu. Protect me from death. 
Sadāśivom. Om peace, peace, peace.
